entry.title: Migrating to Octopress
entry.content:
Change is going on here! The web recently brought to me something I've been looking for a long time: a good static website generator. And the winner is...

Octopress. Ok, you read it in the title already... So what is Octopress? Well it's roughly the equivalent of Wordpress, except that it generates static content, and therefore requires no PHP / other setup on your server. All you have to do is rsync the generated content to your webserver (who said nginx?).

They state it clearly: "a blogging framework for hackers". Content is stored in text files: hassle free, content oriented, versionable... A perfect fit for me!

So as you can see the blog sports the default look of Octopress, without even the beloved Aspyct logo, but it'll come back soon :) Meanwhile, if you spot any mistake in the new blog, you'd be kind to tell me.

Hope you like this new website, (hey, noticed you can now post comments ? :D)

Antoine_935

entry.title: Take on the programming challenge!
entry.content:
So you want to exercise yourself on algorithmics? Check out these links:

  • Code Chef
  • Spotify Challenges

These websites allow you to submit your solutions to test them. Have fun :)

entry.title: Turn your DTD into XML schema
entry.content: Don't feel like writing a full xsd file? Try this good ol' tool provided by the W3C: DTD to XML schema converter. Enjoy :)

entry.title: Attend the Khan Academy
entry.content: Hey, do you also need a little reminder (or more...) about some topics like statistics, algebra or probabilities? Well, the Khan Academy has some nice & easy to watch videos as well as well thought exercises. Ideal for a quiet evening ;) Check it out !

entry.title: Hey, have you met Scapy?
entry.content:
Nothing's better than a little game to learn! As today's theory is TCP/IP networking, how about playing around with you own packets? Scapy allows you to do so. Built on top of the Python interpreter, it offers tools to forge your own network packets. If you're interested in networking, it's definitely something you want to try :)

And now... Let's explore my network! See you soon.
